history.content:
Hi,

My name is Efrat and I'm a postdoc in Prof. Miki Lustig's lab. I'm recruiting motivated and talented undergrads for research projects in our lab, to develop machine learning algorithms for medical imaging. 

If you:

  • Enjoy coding 
  • Are curious about applications of deep learning for medical imaging.
  • Are interested in developing computer vision algorithms with potential clinical applications.

Please apply for this position – come to work with us!

Our research group is focused on Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI). MRI is a fantastic clinical imaging tool, but its long scan duration limits the image resolution and makes the scans prone to motion artifacts. We develop cutting-edge deep-learning algorithms for MRI, to solve problems related to motion correction, super-resolution, hallucinations, etc. Our algorithms enable rapid scans by learning to generate sharp, artifact-free high-resolution images from very limited amounts of data. In short, we use CNNs, ResNets, GANs etc. to develop next-generation MRI algorithms.

You can learn more about our research here:

Prof. Miki Lustig's website - http://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~mlustig/

my (Efrat Shimron) website - http://www.efratshimron.com/

Joining our team will enable you to:

  • Gain valuable hands-on experience in solving real-world problems - to show on your CV later!
  • Develop algorithms for medical images or videos - imagine visualizing a beating heart!
  • Implement the developed algorithms on a real MRI scanner located here at Berkeley – this is very rare! 😊
  • Engage in discussions, present your work, and collaborate with leading professionals.

Requirements from applicants:

  • Background in computer vision & Digital Signal Processing (DSP) (The Fourier Transform etc.)
  • Background in machine learning - at least one course related to computer vision, with coding project(s).
  • Strong coding skills, especially in Python.
  • PyTorch/Tensorflow experience.

The position is open to undergrads only. We're looking for someone who will work with us throughout the 2021/2022 academic year. There's no payment but this could be a fantastic opportunity to gain valuable experience - to add to your CV later when you apply for grad school or industry positions.

If you're interested, please contact me at efrat.s@berkeley.edu and attach your CV and grades transcript.

history.subject: Looking for keen undergrad researchers to develop machine learning apps for medical imaging

history.content:
Hi,

My name is Efrat and I'm a postdoc in Prof. Miki Lustig's lab. I'm recruiting motivated and talented undergrads for research projects in our lab, to develop machine learning algorithms for medical imaging. 

If you:

  • Enjoy coding 
  • Are curious about applications of deep learning for medical imaging.
  • Are interested in developing computer vision algorithms with potential clinical applications.
  • Want to work with a diverse group of scientists and gain significant hands-on research experience for your CV.

Please apply for this position – come to work with us!

Our research group is focused on Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI). MRI is a fantastic clinical imaging tool, but its long scan duration limits the image resolution and makes the scans prone to motion artifacts. We develop cutting-edge deep-learning algorithms for MRI, to solve problems related to motion correction, super-resolution, hallucinations, etc. Our algorithms enable rapid scans by learning to generate sharp, artifact-free high-resolution images from very limited amounts of data. Our work is based on deep neural networks - CNNs, ResNets, GANs, attention layers etc. - and their applications for MRI.

Joining our team will enable you to:

  • Gain hands-on experience in solving real-world problems.
  • Develop algorithms for medical videos - imagine applying your algorithm to improve the video of a beating heart!
  • Implement and test the developed algorithms on a real MRI scanner located here at UC Berkeley – this is highly unique and very rare!! 😊
  • Work in an active research group – engage in discussions, present your work, and collaborate with leading professionals.
  • Collaborate with our colleagues at Stanford’s Children’s Hospital, where the developed MRI algorithms can be deployed clinically.

You can see more about our research here:

Prof. Miki Lustig's website - http://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~mlustig/

my (Efrat Shimron) website - http://www.efratshimron.com/

Requirements from applicants:

  • Background in computer vision & Digital Signal Processing (DSP) (The Fourier Transform, spatial frequencies etc.)
  • Background in machine learning - at least one course related to computer vision, with coding project(s).
  • Strong coding skills, especially in Python.
  • PyTorch/Tensorflow experience.

The position is open to undergrads only. We're looking for someone who will work with us throughout the 2021/2022 academic year. There's no payment but this could be a fantastic opportunity to gain valuable experience - to add to your CV later when you apply for grad school or industry positions.

If you're interested, please contact me at efrat.s@berkeley.edu

Please attach your CV and grades transcript if you apply for this position.

Our ad: https://sites.google.com/d/1E6D5jDy-3-1P1fcByEKq83JmPo3zrcDu/p/1c2kjsQ5U3H47cANTPlsv1kvo02y9cnu_/edit
